item.title: Media
item.description:
Media & Interviews

A collection of media appearances, interviews, and articles where I discuss my work and the broader implications of AI and semantic technologies.

Content is being organized and will be available shortly.

item.title: Papers & Notes
item.description:
Papers & Notes

This section archives my publications, working papers, and research notes, organized along the central research axis of Executable Semantic Order.

  • On the Axioms of Computable Ontology Abstract: This paper lays the foundational axioms for a system where ontological statements can be computationally verified and executed.

  • Notes on Semantic Generative Models Abstract: A collection of thoughts on models that don’t just generate data, but generate structures of meaning that can be used to constrain system behavior.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Projects

A curated list of projects I have worked on, ranging from open-source contributions to specific research implementations. More details will be added soon.

item.title: SlashLife AI
item.description:
SlashLife AI: Commercial Projection of Semantic Order

3.1 Positioning

SlashLife AI is not a standalone product or service, but rather the direct application and commercial manifestation of my core research philosophy—“Executable Semantic Order”—in the enterprise domain.

It aims to answer a core question: How can multiple AI agents (from different providers) in an enterprise collaborate safely, compliantly, and efficiently?

Our positioning is to be the Semantic Middleware for enterprise AI operations, rather than replacing existing enterprise AI models or applications.

item.title: Standards & Governance
item.description:
Standards & Governance: Bringing Semantic Order to Institutions

The value of technology is ultimately reflected in how it integrates with existing institutions and drives their evolution. A core objective of “Executable Semantic Order” is to provide a solid, verifiable technical foundation for the rapidly developing AI field, supporting future governance frameworks.

This page demonstrates how my research interacts with global standardization organizations and governance initiatives.

4.1 Roles & Participation

I primarily contribute my research in the following areas:
